company.name: North American Stamping Group (NASG)
company.overview: A leading manufacturer of metal stampings, welded assemblies, and tooling solutions for the automotive industry.

US.notes: Corporate headquarters, manufacturing space of 235,000 sq. ft. Also known as TN1, TNN1, TN North, TN North 1.
Luke's primary location. Also known as TN2, TNN2, TN North 2.
Facility with focus on medium-to-high-volume production. Also known as Tennessee South, Pulaski, TNS, TN South.

26,000 sq. ft. facility acquired in 2002. Presses range from 160 to 600 tons, supporting progressive stamping, tandem transfer, resistance welding, robotic MIG welding, and washing. Focused on brake and seating components.
Also known as NTA, Tooling & Automation, Automation, Tooling, T&A.
Wire forming and welding-focused facility, 110,000 sq. ft.
Set to close by the end of 2024.
Sales and engineering hub with 3,000 sq. ft. of office space, focused on technical support and market growth for automotive components. Also known as Farmington Hills, Sales.

Canada.notes: Manufacturing plant specializing in progressive stamping and welding.
22,000 sq. ft. tech center for stamping tool design. Also known as NTC, Tech Center.

Mexico.notes: 245,000 sq. ft. facility with presses up to 2000 tons. Also known as Mex, QR01, MX.
65,000 sq. ft. facility for welded assemblies and advanced automation. Also known as Mex 2, QR02, MX2.
